title: Incredibly high ping since 5.1
body:
I'll start the game with around 80-90 (my usual ping), and then all of a sudden it will sky-rocket up to at least 500, and then it usually sits between 500-1200 for the rest of the game, with the few odd cases where it drops to around 100 for all of about 20 seconds. 
I've never experienced ping this high since playing (only around a year), and it's only been this bad since the 5.1 patch. 

Any tips for reducing it? It's making it unplayable at the moment.

replies.body:
That seems like an issue that can be fixed, not something which you just have to work around.

Have you sent in a ticket to support about this yet?

True, sorry haha. 
And I sent in a network diagnostics log yesterday, so I'm waiting to see if I hear back from that.

Would seem like a terrible thing to have to constantly check to make sure that nothing's using your internet, especially if it's a problem that can be fixed.

I mean, at some point you're getting pretty fine ping. Why isn't it staying like that?

Wait, do you have automatic updates enabled for something? It could be that League starting up is triggering it.

That's fair enough, but I have done so. I've made everyone in their house stop using their phones/turn off computers, and it was still going up to around 800, sometimes up to 2k. 

No automatic updates, either. 

I have to admit, it has improved over the last 2 days (a few ARAM games where it would suddenly jump to 2k ping, and then one game where 4 members of my team were all disconnecting at the same time as me, and a few normal games where it would sit at around 80 or so, and just sit at around 200-300 for less than a minute, maybe a few times per game).

It *could* be server issues. I won't deny it.

But man, to go so far as to make sure no one else is using up bandwidth, and you *still* get random lag. Something's definitely up.
A way I try to lower ping is that I turn off the wi-fi for the other devices using the internet.  Sometimes works!

I tried doing that with all the devices that I personally own, but unfortunately there's also 3 other people in my house with several of their own devices, but none of them were doing anything that would cause such high ping :( 
I'll keep that in mind for next time though! (Assuming I can get the rest of them off the internet for a bit to test it).
